definition: to keep one's promise/to mean what one says
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: We always mean what we say do what we promise.
sentences.chinese: 我們一貫是說話算數的。

sentences.english: You may trust him, he is as good as his word.
sentences.chinese: 你可以相信他，他說話算數。

sentences.english: He certainly means what he said.
You promesed to pay me tomorrow, keep your promise!
sentences.chinese: 你說過明天付款的，你要說話算數。

sentences.english: Who can guarantee that he will keep his word?
I am a man of my word .
OOC Talk is only allowed using Tells.
sentences.chinese: OOC是隻允許使用說話算數。

sentences.english: He always keeps to his prom ises.
You promised to pay me today, keep your promise.
sentences.chinese: 你說過今天付款的，你要說話算數。

sentences.english: We always keep to our words.
We Chinese people always mean what we say.
sentences.chinese: 我們中國人從來說話算數。

sentences.english: True to his word, he arrived here on time.
sentences.chinese: 他果然說話算數，按時來了。

sentences.english: I'm serious about this. I mean what I say.
sentences.chinese: 我對此事是認真的，我說話算數。
